channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report E-2023100668
item.description:
Report E-2023100668

  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Associate did not block and/or brace freight properly for transport. Freight was crushed causing release of product.

item.title: Report X-2023100157
item.description:
Report X-2023100157

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-31T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: FREDERICKSBURG
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Tugger driver dropped off hazmat package onto a pallet at the top of van line haphazardly. DescribePack: No spilled liquid outside of package, just a small amount leaked from the lid causing staining to the outside fiberboard. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Lid secured and package was contained within spill bucket.

item.title: Report I-2023100005
item.description:
Report I-2023100005

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-06
  • City: Richmond
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The tank was loaded approximately 4 feet from nose of trailer with a logistic bar in place. When the driver applied the brakes for the truck the tank slid forward in the unit due to a gap being left between the logistic bar causing the tank to rupture and leak. The event was mitigated by the contract environmental company and the remaining contents were transferred into another container for delivery to customer.

item.title: Report I-2023100003
item.description:
Report I-2023100003

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-25T00:33:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: South Hill
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FERRELLGAS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Bobtail Roll Over Accident. The Wheel went off the side of the road, driver tried to pull it back onto the road and lost control. No other vehicles involved. No other property damage. Ferrellgas Employee was injured and taken by ambulance to a local hospital where he was treated and released. There was a minimal release of propane of approx 5.2 gallons. A piping broke that connected to the filler system. The Ferrellgas employee was able to turn the shut off valve to the tank.
